Judul: Diffusive Heat Waves in Random Conformal Field Theory
Abstrak: We propose and study a conformal field theory (CFT) model with random position-dependent velocity that, as we argue, naturally emerges as an effective description of heat transport in one-dimensional quantum many-body systems with certain static random impurities. We present exact analytical results that elucidate how purely ballistic heat waves in standard CFT can acquire normal and anomalous diffusive contributionsduetoourimpurities.Ourresultsincludeimpurity-averagedGreen’sfunctionsdescribing the time evolution of the energy density and the heat current, and an explicit formula for the thermal conductivity that, in addition to a universal Drude peak, has a nontrivial real regular contribution that depends on details of the impurities.
